intro: Psathura, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have basal leaves that are palmately divided, and their flowers are usually small and clustered in racemes. Psathura species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. They are noted for their toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful to humans and animals.
